Job Description

Dayforce, a global leader in Human Capital Management (HCM) with headquarters in Toronto, Ontario, and Minneapolis, Minnesota, operates across North America, EMEA, and APJ regions. Our Cloud HCM platform, recognized for its unified database and continuous calculation engine, enhances efficiency, productivity, and compliance for global workforces. We are committed to "Making Work Life Betterâ„¢" for employees, customers, and partners worldwide.

As an Intern at Dayforce, you'll gain real-world experience with meaningful responsibilities, access to development programs, and the chance to collaborate globally, bringing new ideas and optimizing processes across multiple business units.

Location: Virtual

Duration: 8 or 12 Months (May 2025 - December 2025) OR (May 2025 - April 2026)

Availability: *Full-time availability of 37.5 - 40 hours weekly is required to be eligible for this opportunity.

Benefits for Students:

Experience working for one of the fastest growing Human Capital Management technology companies in the world Access to Dayforce's development programs and resources
Ability to work with as well as create relationships with members across the globe
Autonomy to bring forth new ideas and optimize existing structures within the organization
Meaningful responsibilities, enabling you to obtain 'real-world' experience
Dynamic hands-on exposure to multiple business-units and stakeholders across Dayforce

About the opportunity:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Vulnerability Engineer Intern to join our Information Security team. As an intern, you will assist in identifying, assessing, and managing vulnerabilities across our infrastructure, systems, and applications. You will gain hands-on experience in vulnerability management processes, tools, and methodologies, contributing to the overall security posture of our organization.

What you'll get to do :

Assist in identifying and analyzing security vulnerabilities within internal systems, applications, and networks.

Conduct vulnerability scans using industry-standard tools (e.g., Nessus, Qualys, OpenVAS).

Assist in reviewing and interpreting vulnerability scan reports to determine the severity and potential impact.

Help develop and implement processes to prioritize and remediate vulnerabilities based on risk.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely and effective remediation of vulnerabilities.

Participate in the development of security documentation, including vulnerability management reports and risk assessments.

Monitor and track the status of vulnerability remediation efforts.

Stay updated on the latest vulnerabilities, security trends, and emerging threats.

Skills and experience we value:

Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Cybersecurity, or a related field.

Basic understanding of networking, operating systems (Linux/Windows), and web application security.

Familiarity with vulnerability scanning tools and security testing methodologies.

Knowledge of common security vulnerabilities (e.g., OWASP Top 10, CVE).

Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Eagerness to learn and grow in the field of cybersecurity.

What would really make you stand out:

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) for automating tasks.

Familiarity with common security frameworks and standards (e.g., NIST, CIS, ISO 27001).

Previous internship or academic experience in cybersecurity or IT security.

What's in it for you

Dayforce is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment.

We encourage individuals to apply based on their passions.

Dayforce encourages personal and professional growth. We offer excellent time away from work programs, comprehensive wellness initiatives and recognition through competitive pay and benefits.

With a commitment to community impact, including volunteer days and our charity, Dayforce Cares we provide opportunities for you to thrive both in your career and personal life. Our focus is not just on your job but on supporting you to be the best version of yourself.

Fraudulent Recruiting

Beware of fraudulent recruiting. Legitimate Dayforce contacts will use an @dayforce.com or @Ceridian.com email address. We do not request money, checks, equipment orders, or sensitive personal data during the recruitment process. If you have been asked for any of the above, or believe you have been contacted by someone posing as a Dayforce employee, please refer to our fraudulent recruiting statement.
